messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1743
messages.msgSnippet: Being an unschooler has nothing to do with expecting folks who present themselves as experts to at least have some clue about what they are doing AND to not
messages.messageBody:
Being an unschooler has nothing to do with expecting folks who present
themselves as experts to at least have some clue about what they are doing
AND to not use inuendos or false assumptions to pad their credibility.

What not-a-doc does would be the same as you doing brain surgery. You don't
dissect a psychi using a scalpel, do you? <g>

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: "Julie Stauffer" <jnjstau@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, January 10, 2002 9:29 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1743

> That's odd talk for an unschooler (to paraphrase Ned Pepper).
>
> I have a Master's degree in Clinical Psychology. I ran parenting classes.
> I worked with children for almost 15 years and had training out the wazoo.
>
> It about ruined me as a parent. Not that I'm a fan of Dr. Laura's.
>
> Julie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1743
messages.msgSnippet: That s odd talk for an unschooler (to paraphrase Ned Pepper). I
messages.messageBody:
<<who call themselves "doctors" when they have no education/training in the
subject areas>>

That's odd talk for an unschooler (to paraphrase Ned Pepper).

I have a Master's degree in Clinical Psychology. I ran parenting classes.
I worked with children for almost 15 years and had training out the wazoo.

It about ruined me as a parent. Not that I'm a fan of Dr. Laura's.

Julie
